DOC.brief_title: Effects Movement Training Subacromial Pain Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: Background : Multiple factor associate presence subacromial pain syndrome ( SPS ) , include deficit performance scapular glenohumeral muscle . Such deficit lead inadequate kinematics decrease acromiohumeral distance ( AHD ) . Exercises aim correct deficit , movement training , suggest improve symptom functional limitation . To date , study assess outcomes follow intervention focus movement training . Objectives : Evaluate effect rehabilitation program base movement training symptom , functional limitation AHD individual SPS . Design : Prospective single group pre-post design . Methods : Twenty-five participant SPS ( SPS group ) participate 6-week program . Twenty asymptomatic volunteer recruit normative AHD value ( control group ) . Outcomes group evaluate baseline 6 week , i.e . immediately follow intervention SPS group . Changes symptoms functional limitation SPS group assess use Western Ontario Rotator Cuff index ( WORC ) Disability Arm Shoulder Hand questionnaire ( DASH ) . Changes AHD group assess use ultrasonographic measure .
DOC.criteria: painful arc movement flexion abduction positive Neer KennedyHawkins impingement sign pain resist lateral rotation , abduction empty test . previous shoulder surgery shoulder pain reproduce neck movement clinical sign fullthickness RC tear shoulder capsulitis .
